title: Source: Popovich out of hospital after incident
content: Spurs coach Gregg Popovich was taken to a hospital after an incident at a restaurant Tuesday but is now home and doing fine, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: 'It's just sad': Luka weighs in on Harrison's talk
content: Luka Doncic says he still hasn't spoken to Nico Harrison since being traded to the Lakers -- but has heard what the Mavericks GM has said in justifying his reasoning for the deal.

title: Chisholm suspended 1 game for conduct, tweet
content: Major League Baseball suspended Yankees infielder Jazz Chisholm Jr. for one game and fined him an undisclosed amount, the result of his actions during Thursday night's win against the Rays. He will appeal.

title: Raiders GM Spytek strong believer in drafting RB
content: Raiders general manager John Spytek said he is a strong believer in taking running backs high in the draft, but added that he is "open-minded" to taking a quarterback.

title: QB Dart no longer on list of NFL draft attendees
content: QB Jaxson Dart, who had earlier been confirmed to be attending the NFL draft in Green Bay, now will not be in attendance, with no reason being given for the change.

title: Lakers sign Pelinka to extension, add to his title
content: The Lakers have signed Rob Pelinka to a multiyear contract extension and added to his title by naming him president of basketball operations and general manager.

title: Jays' Scherzer gets 2nd cortisone shot in thumb
content: Blue Jays pitcher Max Scherzer received a second cortisone shot in his right thumb and will try playing catch again when he rejoins the team in Houston next week.

title: Ex-Jazz owners buy RSL, Utah Royals for $600M
content: The Larry H. Miller Family, in conjunction with Miller Sports & Entertainment, has acquired a controlling interest in MLS side Real Salt Lake and the NWSL's Utah Royals.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs mega-preview: Championship cases, X factors, bold predictions for all 16 teams
content: The postseason Thunderdome is about to open its gate. Which team will emerge as the 2025 Stanley Cup champion?

title: Lapsed fan's guide to the 2025 playoffs: The NHL's second season begins
content: Miss anything the past six months? Miss EVERYTHING? Here are the top teams, players, matchups and more.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: ‘I’ll beat you tomorrow for $10k’: Inside the secret world of MLB pickleball
content: Here's how the pickleball court is replacing the golf course as where the baseball world gets away from the game.

title: A roller coaster of a day: The highs and lows of NCAA gymnastics semifinals
content: The NCAA gymnastics semifinals were as wild as predicted, with major upsets to both No. 1 LSU and No. 3 Florida.

title: Bill Belichick's new book underscores the importance of personal connections
content: Bill Belichick's new book, "The Art of Winning: Lessons from My Life in Football," highlights the role relationships play in the sport.

title: The long fight ahead for boxing's Heather Hardy
content: The former boxing champ uses her brain injury to call for systemic changes to improve the health and education of fighters.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to WrestleMania 41: John Cena thinks you're awful
content: As a service to fans who have a general interest in WWE, we're happy to provide this WrestleMania 41 FAQ.

title: Sources: Man Utd eye Dibling if they win Europa
content: Manchester United will step up their interest in Southampton midfielder Tyler Dibling if they secure UCL qualification, sources have told ESPN.

title: Wrexham promotion hopes dented after draw
content: Wrexham's bid for a third straight promotion took a hit when the Welsh side drew with Bristol Rovers 1-1 and slipped one spot into third place Friday.

title: LAFC boss Cherundolo to step down at end of '25
content: LAFC head coach Steve Cherundolo will step down from his role at the end of the 2025 season, the MLS club announced Friday.

title: Amorim: United need young players vs. Wolves
content: Ruben Amorim has admitted it's not the right time to throw Manchester United's young players into Premier League action, but says he may be forced to take risks as he prioritises the Europa League.

title: James: Chelsea didn't 'prepare right' before defeat
content: Chelsea captain Reece James has said his side "disrespected the competition" as they lost 2-1 to Polish side Legia Warsaw in the UEFA Conference League quarterfinal on Thursday.

title: Flick rails at LaLiga schedule: 'It's a joke'
content: Hansi Flick praised his team's resilience with the club still competing on three fronts this season but complained about the timing of their next LaLiga match against Celta Vigo as he wanted to give his players some more rest.

title: Transfer tracker: Latest entrants and commitments
content: The transfer cycle is in full swing. We're tracking the latest players to enter the portal and commit.

title: Former champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. is the right opponent for Jake Paul
content: Chavez's best day are in his rearview mirror, but this matchup is a big step up in competition for Paul.

title: Champions League semifinal predictions: Arsenal or PSG? Barcelona or Inter Milan?
content: We're down to the final four in Europe's top club competition, so who do we think has the power, talent and grit to reach the final? Our writers make their picks.

title: MLS, Saudi Arabia or another club in Europe: What's next for Kevin de Bruyne?
content: Premier League superstar Kevin De Bruyne will be a free agent soon as Man City opted not to renew him. So, with MLS and Saudi interest, what will he do next?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern have advantage to sign Wirtz
content: Bayern believe they are in pole position to sign Bayer Leverkusen's Florian Wirtz. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 'I found your dad': The mystery of a missing climber
content: Bill Stampfl vanished climbing Peru's highest mountain 22 years ago. This is the story of the hiker who found him and brought closure to Stampfl's family.

title: Carroll hits 35 homers? Soderstrom hits 50? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: In Bengal’s Murshidabad, scars from a communal fire
content: On April 11 and 12, protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, in Murshidabad district turned violent, leaving three people dead and hundreds homeless. Moyurie Som reports on the survivors and the communal fault lines that are deepening across West Bengal

title: Not allowed to attend Friday prayers, bid to pressurise me: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
content: The ruling National Conference (NC) took exception to the move to bar the Mirwaiz from attending Friday prayers

title: India is a main player on world stage today: IGN Chair Ambassador AlBanai
content: Tareq AlBanai, who is Kuwait’s Permanent Representative to the UN, said that India will be a major contender in the process of reforming the UNSC

title: Data-centric policing, new-age technologies must for J&K Police to end terrorism in J&K: LG Manoj Sinha
content: He was speaking at the passing out parade function of the latest batch of Basic Recruit Training Course (BRTC) of the J&K Police Constables in Ganderbal, where 438 recruits, including 86 women, completed their training

title: CGPSC case: CBI raids middlemen in Raipur, Mahasamund
content: Last November, the CBI had arrested former CGPSC chairman Taman Singh Sonwani and others, including Shravan Kumar Goyal, then Director of Shri Bajarang Power and Ispat Ltd.

title: Second edition of three-week triservice ‘future warfare course’ from next week
content: The programme will consist of comprehensive curriculum covering specialised subjects, with the aim of the course being to align operational priorities with capabilities of the indigenous defence industry and facilitate open discussions on various facets of modern and future warfare.

title: Technician arrested for sexual harassment of flight attendant at Gurugram hospital
content: The victim was allegedly sexually harassed while on a ventilator in a semi-conscious state during treatment

title: Why is Jharkhand CM taking his wife for an official trip to Sweden, Spain instead of Industry Minister, BJP asks
content: BJP’s Jharkhand chief Babulal Marandi asks in what capacity MLA Kalpana Soren is part of the delegation in place of the Industry Minister Sanjay Prasad Yadav, an RJD leader

title: Canada Election 2025: 5 Unusual Facts About The Canadian Parliamentary Polls
content: As Canada preps to elect a new government on April 28, the two parties that are leading the race - the Conservative Party and the Liberal Party - are in close contest. This is a parliamentary election, but the Canadian polls have some unique facts.

title: 5 Dead After Roof Collapses In UP's Meerut: Cops
content: Five members of a family were killed when the roof of their house collapsed during a strong storm in this district on Friday evening, police said.

title: US Could Quit Ukraine Talks If No Progress, Warns Trump
content: US President Donald Trump said Thursday that Washington could quit talks to end the Ukraine war within days unless there is rapid progress from Moscow and Kyiv.

title: "Fake News": Manipur Congress Leader Denies Helping Kukis In Audio Tape Case
content: The Manipur BJP has denied allegations by a Congress spokesperson and lawyer from the Meitei community of spreading rumours that he helped the Kuki tribes in pursuing a case, being heard in the Supreme Court, against N Biren Singh.

title: Canada Polls 2025: Who Are The Big Players, What Are The Parties
content: This Canadian election marks a significant shift, as it's the first time in a decade without former Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on the ballot.

title: Man, His 3 Minor Daughters Killed As Truck Rams Bike In Gujarat: Cops
content: A 36-year-old man and his three minor daughters were killed after a truck hit their motorcycle near Godhra town in Gujarat's Panchmahal district on Friday, police said.

title: US Will Soon "Take A Pass" If No Progress On Ukraine Deal, Says Trump
content: President Donald Trump said Friday the United States will "take a pass" on brokering further Ukraine war talks unless there is quick progress from Moscow and Kyiv.

title: Delhi Government To Deploy 1000 GPS Enabled Water Tankers: Parvesh Verma
content: Water Minister Parvesh Verma on Friday said the Delhi government will deploy 1,000 GPS-enabled water tankers across the capital to boost supply in view of the summer season.

title: University Professor Claims Assault By Troops In J&K's Rajouri, Army Orders Probe
content: The Indian Army on Friday ordered an inquiry after a university professor accused the troops of assaulting him during the checking of vehicles at a village in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district, officials said.

title: Man, 67, Assaulted Outside Delhi Home. Dies Later In Hospital
content: A group of men beat up a 67-year-old man near his home in Delhi's Shahdara on Friday noon, shows a video. The man later died at a city hospital.

title: Mob Blackens Bahadur Shah Zafar's Mural In Ghaziabad, Say It Was Aurangzeb's
content: Activists of a right-wing Hindu outfit smeared black paint on a mural of the last Mughal emperor, Bahadur Shah Zafar, at Ghaziabad railway station on Friday, officials said.

title: Canada Election 2025: Stats, Timings, Candidates - All Your Questions Answered
content: Canada will vote for a new government on April 28, with the hope of a decisive mandate - strong enough to push back attempts by Donald Trump, who wants to make Canada America's 51st state. Know all about the Canadian elections in this article.

title: Canada Polls: Gujaratis Make Electoral Debut In Canada As Punjabis Seek Re-Election
content: Gujaratis have emerged as a major bloc, even as Punjabis remain a force to be reckoned with in Canada's political sphere, as immigrants of Indian origin steadily gain ground in the North American country which will hold federal elections this month.

title: Abhishek Singhvi On "Venerable Old Power Article 142" And Veep's Comments On Supreme Court
content: Congress MP and lawyer Abhishek Manu Singhvi has termed Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar's criticism of the Supreme Court as a matter which "absolutely needed no comment" from the holder of the second-highest constitutional office.

title: 7 Day Deadline Set For GST Registration Grant
content: Businesses will be able to get GST registration within 7 days, while applications flagged as risky will be processed within 30 days after physical verification of the premises.

title: Defence Secretary calls on U.K. industry to explore partnerships with Indian defence start ups
content: During his visit to London, Rajesh Kumar Singh discussed with top U.K. officials and business leaders the strengthening of collaboration in manufacturing of naval systems, drones, surveillance, defence space, and aviation.

title: Controversy plagues release of ex-R&AW chief Dulat’s book
content: The Chief Minister and The Spy had run into controversy over certain statements attributed to former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah on the abrogation of Article 370, which purportedly indicated that the veteran politician had ‘privately backed’ the move

title: Jaishankar must take up U.S. visa issue with Rubio, says Congress
content: Out of the 327 visa revocation cases of international students collected by the American Immigration Lawyers Association so far, 50% are Indians, says Congress communications chief Jairam Ramesh

title: FY25 India pharma exports cross $30 billion, surge 31% in March
content: A key component of India’s trade basket, exports rose more than 9% to touch $30 billion for the first time; pharmaceuticals did not figure in the 26% U.S. tariffs, now on hold for 90 days

title: Pakistan raises Kashmir issue in Foreign Office Consultation with Bangladesh in Dhaka
content: Statement issued by the Pakistan’s MoFA informed that the two sides also ‘reaffirmed’ the need to revitalise SAARC

title: U.P. police gives clean chit to Sambhal CO over “controversial” remark
content: Complainant Amitabh Thakur says State DGP is protecting the officer in question over his controversial comments regarding Holi celebrations and Friday namaz

title: Congress launches ‘Mahila Ki Baat’ to reach out to women voters ahead of Bihar Assembly polls
content: All India Mahila Congress Committee launches “Mahila Ki Baat, Congress Ke Saath” campaign in Bihar to include women’s needs in election manifesto

title: BCI condemns attack on its co-chairman Sadashiva Reddy at his office in Bengaluru
content: BCI Chairperson Manan Kumar Mishra says the injuries suffered by Reddy are “not random injuries, these are blows aimed at silencing, at crippling, and at intimidating a senior advocate and an elected representative of legal fraternity”

title: Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh marries party Mahila Morcha leader
content: Dilip Ghosh has been considered as the most successful party president in the State and under his leadership the party won 18 of the 42 Lok Sabha seats in the State in 2019 Lok Sabha polls

title: Hindi cannot be imposed on Maharashtra students: Congress
content: Maharashtra Congress President criticises BJP for imposing Hindi, calls for respect of regional languages and cultural diversity

title: Two cheetahs to be moved from Kuno to second home at Gandhi Sagar on April 20
content: Original plan to bring new cheetahs from South Africa to Gandhi Sagar delayed, so animals are being shifted from Kuno, an official says; discussed moving cheetahs to Gujarat’s Banni Grasslands too, says Environment Minister

title: Aaditya Thackeray targets Mahayuti, warns of ‘destruction in the name of development’
content: The Shiva Sena (UBT) hit out at the approval granted for the Gargai dam project in Palghar, claiming it would lead to the cutting of nearly five lakh trees to supply 450 MLD of water to Mumbai

title: No GST on UPI transactions over ₹2,000, clarifies government
content: Finance Ministry says reports that said that the government is considering levying GST on UPI transactions over ₹2,000, are completely false, misleading, and without any basis.

title: CBI takes over case of Chhattisgarh ex-bureaucrats, former AG influencing NAN-scam probe
content: The alleged scam pertained to procurement of sub-standard rice and salt by NAN, Chhattisgarh’s nodal agency for procuring and distributing food grains under the Public Distribution System

title: Primary school in violence-hit Murshidabad resumes classes as tensions remain high
content: “Teachers of the school went from door-to-door convincing the guardians to let the children come to school. Many were convinced, and many students are attending regular classes,” says principal Alam

title: Flight With PM Modi's Key Official On Board Diverted Due To Cracks On Runway In Odisha
content: A flight carrying 178 passengers, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi's principal secretary PK Mishra, was diverted to Bhubaneswar airport on Friday after the aircraft was unable to land at Jharsuguda due to cracks on the runway, officials said.

title: Who Is Ziqra? Social Media-Savvy 'Lady Don' Linked To Delhi Teen's Murder
content: Ziqra is frequently seen roaming around Seelampur with a pistol and had also waved the gun around during Holi celebrations. Videos of her with the gun led to a case against her under the Arms Act.

title: Actor Shine Tom Chacko Gets Police Notice After Allegedly Fleeing From Hotel Raid
content: The Kochi city police on Friday served a notice to actor Shine Tom Chacko, directing him to appear for questioning in connection with an incident where he allegedly fled from a hotel during an anti-drug raid.

title: Amit Shah Urges Hiding Maoists To Surrender, Join Mainstream
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday asked all underground Maoists to surrender as soon as possible and join the mainstream, saying the government is determined to free the country from the scourge of Maoism before March 31, 2026.

title: Applying For A US Visa? Why A Visit To Gaza After 2007 Could Mean Trouble
content: Rubio previously reported that his office had revoked over 300 visas since the beginning of the year, including those of student visa holders who have expressed criticism towards Israel's actions in Gaza.

title: SHRC holds two PSIs guilty of harassing a minor rape victim’s mother, violating POCSO guidelines, slaps them with ₹50,000 fine
content: The inquiry found that despite strict guidelines from the High Court of Karnataka on handling POCSO Act cases, the accused officials violated the guidelines at every level to help the accused and their family members

title: Mahim Koliwada women SHGs to receive Food Safety Training certificate
content: The certificate will be given in the presence of Deputy Chief Minister City Eknath Shinde and Food and Drug’s Cabinet Minister Narhari Zirwal on April 23

title: 51,784 vacancies in Tripura departments, Congress alleges
content: Congress announced plans to launch protests across the State to raise awareness about the discrepancies between the ruling party’s statements and the reality of the employment scenario

title: Forest department plans population study of grizzled giant squirrel in Pakkamalai and Gangavaram hills
content: The study will help the department draw up a conservation strategy by gathering the baseline data of the squirrel, an endangered species listed under Schedule I of the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972 and provide a fillip to the long-pending demand for notifying the hills as a wildlife sanctuary, say sources

title: Power supply disrupted in many areas of City, restoration work on
content: TGSPDCL disaster response teams got down to the restoration work by removing the tree branches from T&D lines to restore supply by restoring the damaged lines

title: Manipur Congress leader seeks security after rumours link him to ‘audio tapes’ case
content: The tapes, allegedly involving former Chief Minister Nongthombam Biren Singh, are related to the ethnic violence that broke out in the State in May 2023

title: BBMP introduces within property tax payment system an option for declaration of bulk waste
content: The bulk waste generators are exempted from the user fee after declaration on the property tax portal

title: Move to allot 100 acres for private hotel project near Similipal Tiger Reserve opposed
content: “The tourism project will severely impact the livelihood and religious beliefs of local tribal communities,” Rakesh Kumar Mohanty, the petitioner, alleged; proposed land lies within 700 metres of the reserve’s boundary

title: SIT probe into liquor scam: Kasireddy Rajashekar Reddy alone can spill the beans, says Vijaya Sai Reddy
content: The former Rajya Sabha member attends investigation, says he has been questioned on liquor policy, kickbacks, sale of NDPL, new liquor companies, and other issues

title: Civilian ‘thrashed’ by Army officer during search operations in Rajouri; Army orders inquiry
content: The Army ordered an inquiry on April 18 following an outcry, even as it claimed that there was an attempt of ‘weapon snatching’ by the victim

title: Tejashwi is the CM face of the Mahagathbandhan: Manoj Jha
content: Mr. Jha’s assertion comes a day after Mr. Yadav was appointed head of the INDIA coordination committee; welcomes SC direction on Waqf amendments, slams Bihar CM for compromising on issue

title: Muthukur to be developed as a model village under P4
content: Adani group to focus on the areas of renewable energy, sanitation, education and empowerment in the village

title: KEA to bar candidates who get seats in prestigious medical and technical institutions from CET counselling
content: In a suspected scam last year, Internet Protocol addresses of students were misused to block engineering seats in prestigious private colleges

title: Field-level officers asked to reach out to villages and improve policing
content: Tiruchi SP asks officers serving at the police stations to hold periodic meetings with village vigilance awareness committees and keep a tab on the movements of rowdies

title: Four-year old boy dies at Kerala’s Konni elephant camp after concrete pillar falls on him
content: The accident was caused by one of the pillars installed as part of the beautification of the elephant camp. Police said the pillar was not properly secured

title: With more pilgrims travelling on foot to Samayapuram, NHAI urged to pave a pedestrian lane along the highway
content: Devotees walk during the day and at night along the Tiruchi-Chennai highway and other roads heading to Samayapuram without bothering about the weather conditions

title: Tension palpable as GVMC gears up to discuss no-trust move against Mayor on April 19
content: The YSRCP and the Left parties decide to boycott the session; the NDA claims to have the support of 76 members, two more than the magic figure needed to win the motion

title: Indian electronics manufacturing trusted for respecting IP: Vaishnaw
content: Indian electronics firms respect IP, and are more reliable, IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said at a manufacturing facility visit

title: DGCA orders probe into Air India Express pilot’s death
content: Pilot fell unconscious inside the aircraft soon after his flight last week; family claims it took 40 minutes to provide him medical assistance

title: 'Going to say you're fools': Trump warns US may shift course if no Russia-Ukraine deal
content: President Trump declared the U.S. will promptly withdraw from mediating a Russia-Ukraine agreement if a ceasefire isn't achieved soon. This follows Secretary of State Marco Rubio's statement in Paris that Washington might abandon peace efforts within days without clear progress.

title: Military operations crippled as ALHs continue to remain grounded
content: The Indian armed forces are facing significant operational challenges due to the grounding of approximately 330 'Dhruv' ALH helicopters, exacerbating existing shortages caused by the obsolete Cheetah and Chetak choppers. This disruption has severely impacted military operations, especially sustenance flights to forward areas and reconnaissance missions.

title: Army orders probe after Ignou professor alleges assault by troops in J&K
content: The Army has initiated an inquiry following allegations that an IGNOU professor was assaulted by troops during a vehicle check in Rajouri district. The professor, Liaqat Ali, reportedly sustained head injuries. The Army claims Ali attempted to seize a soldier's weapon, leading to a scuffle, but assures a thorough investigation and appropriate action if misconduct is proven.

title: 4 sheds, 3 crores, 2 nations, 1 dream: Story of India Aryabhata
content: In 1975, India launched its first satellite, Aryabhata, from a Soviet cosmodrome, marking a pivotal moment in its space program. Despite challenges and limited resources, a dedicated team of Indian scientists built the satellite in just 30 months.

title: As trade deficit mounts, China 'ready' to import premium goods from India
content: Amid trade tensions, China is seeking stronger ties with India, offering to boost Indian exports to address the trade deficit. Ambassador Xu Feihong hopes India will provide a fair environment for Chinese businesses. China welcomes PM Modi to the SCO summit, emphasizing dialogue for a stable relationship. Both nations aim to resolve border issues peacefully, focusing on mutual development.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber: Elon Musk isn’t coming back, his next move is...
content: Tesla investor Ross Gerber has intensified his criticism of Elon Musk, asserting that Musk's focus has shifted to X AI and he no longer prioritizes Tesla. Gerber highlighted the negative impact of Musk's social media activity and political associations on Tesla's reputation. Despite a decline in Tesla's stock and sales, Gerber's firm continues to hold shares, anticipating a potential turnaround.

title: IPL: Wadhera proves decisive in steering PBKS over the line against RCB
content: In a bowler-dominated match, Nehal Wadhera's crucial unbeaten 33 propelled Punjab Kings to victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru, inflicting their third home defeat. Tim David's unbeaten fifty helped RCB reach 95/9 in a rain-shortened game, but Wadhera's aggressive hitting against Hazlewood and Sharma turned the tide, securing PBKS's climb to second place in the points table.

title: Sambhal SIT charges 2 with twin murders, duo linked to Dubai fugitive
content: The SIT filed a 500-page chargesheet in the alleged murders of Mohd Bilal and Ayan during the Shahi Jama Masjid survey violence in Sambhal. Ghulam Shah and Mulla Afroz, with alleged ties to Dubai-based Shariq Satha, face charges for murder and inciting violence. The investigation suggests Satha orchestrated the unrest and supplied weapons, with recovered bullets indicating potential external links.

title: Hindu leader abducted, killed in Bangladesh’s Dinajpur
content: Bhabesh Chandra Roy, a Hindu community leader, was kidnapped from his home in Dinajpur, Bangladesh, and later found dead. Family reports indicate he was abducted by four men on motorcycles and brutally assaulted. India has responded by urging Bangladesh to focus on protecting its minorities, dismissing comments about violence in West Bengal.

title: DHS explains why CBP emailed US citizen Nicole Micheroni to self-deport
content: Immigration attorney Nicole Micheroni mistakenly received a DHS email ordering her to "self-deport immediately," sparking concern and confusion. The email, linked to the CBP One app's parole program, was sent due to a data entry error. Micheroni clarified that such notices don't equate to deportation orders and advised seeking legal counsel.

title: 800-page chargesheet filed against 'insurance mafia'
content: Police in Sambhal, UP, have filed charges against 11 individuals from UP, Bihar, and Jharkhand, involved in a massive insurance scam. This "insurance mafia" created fraudulent life insurance policies, targeting the terminally ill and deceased, to defraud companies like ICICI Prudential and SBI Life Insurance.

title: HC upholds conviction of 7 for forging WW2 MIA soldier's will to grab land
content: The Punjab and Haryana High Court upheld the conviction of seven villagers for attempting to fraudulently acquire land by forging the will of a World War II soldier who disappeared in 1943. The villagers falsely claimed the soldier lived with one of them and died leaving a will.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke to parents: Make your kid learn …
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke advocates for early coding education, integrating it into school curriculums alongside subjects like physics and math. Despite AI's increasing role in simplifying software development, Dohmke emphasizes continuous learning for programmers.

title: Hospital technician arrested in Gurugram flight attendant sexual assault case
content: A hospital technician, Deepak, has been arrested in Gurugram for allegedly sexually assaulting a 46-year-old flight attendant on a ventilator at Medanta Hospital. The incident reportedly occurred on April 6, prompting a police investigation involving CCTV footage review and staff questioning. The accused has confessed and is scheduled for court appearance, while the hospital cooperates with the ongoing investigation.

title: Seelampur teen murder: 'Lady Don' held as cops probe gang rivalry angle
content: In New Seelampur, Delhi, a 17-year-old named Kunal was fatally stabbed, igniting local tensions. Police are investigating Zikra, a woman with alleged ties to a jailed gangster, for her potential involvement. The murder appears to be a revenge act for a prior assault on Zikra's cousin, leading to community unrest and police deployment to maintain order.

title: Move to establish theme park at Mukkombu welcomed
content: The theme park is to be stablished under the public private participation mode and a preliminary study has already been conducted to know the feasibility

title: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla set for space travel in May
content: A decorated test pilot with the Indian Air Force, Group Captain Shukla was shortlisted under ISRO's Human Spaceflight Program and is among the top contenders for the Gaganyaan mission

title: NCERT insists all new school textbooks were ‘named thoughtfully’
content: The response from National Council of Education Research and Training comes after a controversy erupted over NCERT using Hindi titles for English language textbooks

title: Karaikal anganwadi workers seek reimbursement for fuel and vegetable expenses
content: Employees’ federation says several workers had not received their salaries for months and they were forced to use personal funds to prepare meals for children

title: Probe into pregnant leopard’s death in A.P.: tension as villagers object to ‘unjust detention of innocents’
content: Despite alerting the Forest Department quite early, the rescue team arrived late, and the prolonged lapse of time led to the animal’s death due to exhaustion and thirst, the villagers insist; they appeal to Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan to ensure an unbiased inquiry into the issue

title: Tiruchi city police to step up surveillance near Chathiram bus stand with more cameras
content: About 12 surveillance cameras are to be installed additionally at vantage points to cover the Karur bypass which is abuzz all through the day as a crime prevention measure

title: Vasectomy failure does not imply medical negligence: HC
content: The Punjab and Haryana High Court reversed compensation for a couple who conceived after a vasectomy failure, citing no medical negligence and a lack of due care. The court referenced a Supreme Court verdict, noting pregnancy post-sterilization can occur naturally, with termination as an option.

title: Combing operations enter Day 5 in Poonch
content: The search operation for terrorists who escaped after an encounter in Poonch, J&K, has entered its fifth day. IGP Bhim Sen Tuti assessed the operational readiness of troops, emphasizing the resurgence of terrorism in the region over the past two years. Security forces are conducting extensive search operations, including aerial surveillance, to counter the threat and maintain peace.

title: Bengal guv meets Murshidabad violence victims, NCW flags molestation claims: Key points
content: West Bengal governor CV Ananda Bose visited Malda to assess the situation of Murshidabad riot victims, hearing accounts of intimidation and assault. Ignoring the CM's request to postpone, he assured proactive action. Simultaneously, an NCW team reported women were molested and forcibly evicted, while the VHP plans nationwide protests demanding President's rule, highlighting the escalating tensions and political fallout.

title: Mirwaiz barred from Friday prayers again
content: Kashmir's chief cleric, Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, was once again placed under house arrest, preventing him from leading Friday prayers at Srinagar's Jamia Masjid. This marks the fourth consecutive Friday Mirwaiz has been barred, sparking criticism from the Anjuman Auqaf Jamia Masjid and the National Conference, who decried the restrictions as unjust and a violation of religious freedom.

title: IPL lowest score: Where does RCB's 95/9 vs PBKS stand?
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru suffered a batting disaster against Punjab Kings in a rain-shortened IPL 2025 match, managing only 95 runs for 9 wickets. This dismal performance ranks among the tournament's lowest scores, reminiscent of their infamous 49 all out in 2017.

title: A day after invite for talks from MHA, Ladakh parties blow hot and cold
content: Ladakhi political parties express optimism ahead of the May 20th meeting with the Union Home Ministry in New Delhi, hoping for resolutions on recruitment, reservations, and domicile issues. While anticipating discussions on statehood and sixth schedule status, they warn of potential agitations if the meeting fails to yield positive results.

title: Government denies reports of levying GST on UPI transactions over Rs 2000
content: The government has refuted claims of imposing GST on UPI transactions exceeding ₹2,000, dismissing them as baseless. The finance ministry clarified that GST applies only to charges like MDR, which are not levied on UPI. UPI transactions have surged, reaching ₹260.56 lakh crore projected by March 2025.

title: Wanted Punjab gangster-turned-terrorist arrested in US had links with ISI: FBI
content: The FBI has apprehended Harpreet Singh in Sacramento, California, wanted in India for multiple terror attacks across Punjab. Singh, linked to Pakistan's ISI and the Khalistani group Babbar Khalsa International, illegally entered the US and used burner phones to evade capture. He is accused of masterminding attacks and supplying resources to operatives.

title: US and China torch each other in propaganda war
content: The US and China are locked in a fierce propaganda war over tariffs, each portraying the other as weak. China uses AI-generated videos mocking Americans’ health and economic ambitions, while also targeting US officials personally. Both sides deploy partisan “experts” to push their views. Social media is flooded with claims of China’s economic decline and growing unrest.

title: 'Should resign immediately': Opposition slams VP Dhankhar's comments on SC
content: Opposition leaders have strongly criticised Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar's remarks questioning the Supreme Court's authority, accusing him of undermining the judiciary and violating constitutional norms. They defended the Supreme Court’s role in ensuring justice and protecting legislative authority. Leaders from Congress, TMC, RJD, DMK, and Kapil Sibal have called for institutional sensitivity and respect for the separation of powers.

title: Hoax bomb threat at Kanpur airport triggers panic, 21-year-old arrested
content: Chakeri Airport in Kanpur was briefly thrown into panic on Friday following a hoax bomb threat targeting a 72-seater flight. Authorities swiftly responded, deploying security teams and conducting a thorough search of the airport premises, which revealed no explosives. Police successfully tracked down and arrested a 21-year-old man, Mohit Singh, who confessed to making the prank call, leading to his booking under relevant legal sections.

title: Rain brings relief to Delhi as gusty winds sweep across city
content: Delhi experienced light to moderate rainfall on Friday evening, providing relief from the intense heat. Gusty winds and thunderstorms swept through central, south, and west Delhi, with wind speeds reaching 30-40 kmph. The IMD forecasts partly cloudy skies with light rain, dust storms, and thunderstorms for Saturday, although the air quality remains in the 'poor' category.

title: Watch: KL Rahul fans distribute food on batter's 33rd birthday
content: On KL Rahul's 33rd birthday, fans in Telangana celebrated by feeding over 160 homeless people, showcasing kindness and compassion. This heartwarming gesture coincided with Rahul's announcement of welcoming a baby girl, Evaarah, with wife Athiya Shetty. The cricketer, currently with Delhi Capitals, received an outpouring of love and congratulations as his fans made his birthday about giving back.

title: Ahmadiyya minority beaten to death by anti-blasphemy group in Pakistan
content: In Karachi, Pakistan, a member of the Ahmadiyya community was fatally beaten by a mob, including members of Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP), who attacked an Ahmadi place of worship. The mob accused the community of violating anti-Ahmadi laws, leading to violence and arrests.

title: ​Which minerals are found in Ukraine and what are they used for
content: Ukraine and the United States have reached an initial understanding on a minerals deal, paving the way for an economic partnership agreement and an investment fund for Ukraine's reconstruction. Ukraine holds significant reserves of critical minerals like graphite, titanium, and uranium, essential for various industries including renewable energy, aerospace, and defence.

title: Trump admin has revoked over 1,000 student visas without warning since March
content: Over 1,000 international students, including those at Harvard and Stanford, have had their US visas revoked, causing widespread confusion and legal challenges. Universities discovered the terminations through a Homeland Security database, often without prior notice or explanation. Lawsuits allege unlawful revocations and lack of due process.

title: Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh marries party colleague Rinku Majumdar
content: Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh, 60, married Rinku Majumdar, a leader in the party's women's wing, in a private ceremony at his Kolkata residence. The wedding photos quickly circulated on social media, surprising many within the party, especially given Ghosh's potential bid for state BJP chief. A reception is planned in Kharagpur. Party sources say Ghosh first met Majumdar during his tenure as state BJP president, when she was active in Kolkata South’s organisational work.

title: Taylor Swift on next Madden cover? Robert Griffin III thinks it's game-changing
content: Former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III proposed featuring Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce on the cover of Madden NFL 25 to boost sales. Griffin highlighted Swift's immense popularity and her impact on NFL viewership, suggesting their image from Super Bowl LVIII could make it the best-selling Madden game ever.

title: BJP claims police debunked Mamata's blame on 'outsiders' for Bengal violence
content: BJP leader Amit Malviya has challenged Mamata Banerjee's claims regarding the Murshidabad communal violence, citing police reports that contradict her narrative of "outsiders" being responsible. Malviya alleges that the violence, which resulted in three deaths and numerous arrests, was instigated by local youths, as indicated by intelligence inputs and police findings.

title: 'Personal fallouts being given criminal colour': HC grants bail to rape accused
content: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to Arun Kumar Mishra, accused of rape, raising concerns about failed relationships leading to criminal charges. Justice Krishan Pahal noted the consensual nature of the relationship and the delayed FIR filing. The court highlighted a societal trend of transient relationships and cautioned against misusing penal laws amid emotional fallout.

title: DGCA orders probe into Air India Express captain Armaan's death
content: Following the tragic death of Air India Express First Officer Armaan after a Srinagar-Delhi flight, the DGCA has launched a thorough investigation. The probe will examine his medical history, airport medical care, and adherence to rostering protocols. ALPA has highlighted the urgent need for improved pilot rest regulations and mental health support within the aviation industry, emphasizing concerns about pilot welfare and working conditions.

title: Watch: Rohit opens up on having Wankhede stand named after him
content: In a moving tribute, the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) has decided to name a stand at Wankhede Stadium after Rohit Sharma, celebrating his leadership and contributions, including recent World Cup and Champions Trophy wins. Additionally, stands will be named after the late Ajit Wadekar, honoring his historic Test series victories, and Sharad Pawar, recognizing his role in transforming Wankhede.

title: International space mission carrying Indian astronaut to fly in May: Centre
content: India marks a new milestone in space exploration as IAF Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is set to fly to the ISS in May 2025 as part of Axiom Mission 4. Selected for this NASA-approved private spaceflight, Shukla will be the second Indian in space after Rakesh Sharma.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers, Mets or Padres No. 1 this week?
content: the los Angeles Dodgers have fallen from the top spot thanks to a recent rough patch . the New york Mets, San Diego Padres or San Francisco Giants replaced the defending champions atop our week 3 Power Rankings .

title: What's behind this stifling, confusing LeBron-led Lakers defense
content: the lakers had defeated the Knicks 128-112 behind a stout defensive effort . a box score offered clues at how they'd done it . the next game, 122-97 win over the Clippers, offered more evidence .

title: 2025 college baseball ace rankings: The best starting pitchers
content: the aim here is to rank college starting pitchers based on who I would want to start a game in Omaha with the highest stakes, against the best lineups . this isn't a prospect list -- I lean more on current ability rather than in the future .

title: Spring transfer portal: Recapping news, rumors and analysis from Day 1
content:
Pete Thamel tells Pat McAfee that Nico Iamaleava is unlikely find a situation where he gets his asking price through the portal. (1:17) College football 's spring transfer portal period opened Wednesday and runs through April 25. More than  2,700 players  have elected to transfer this offseason. This period is the last chance for underclassmen to switch teams before the start of the 2025 season and for schools to bolster their roster. The biggest news of the spring period happened this past weekend when  Tennessee   parted ways  with quarterback  Nico Iamaleava . The former four-star recruit, who threw 19 touchdown passes in 2024, was seeking an increase in his  NIL package . He is now looking for a new home, and  UCLA is in the hunt . With players officially able to enter their names in the portal, we tracked all the latest news and developments. Here's a look at how Day 1 unfolded.  Transfer portal coverage: 
 Best available player rankings

content: argentina's Lionel Messi has doubled down on his recent feud with fans . the clashes between the Albiceleste and El Tri have become a world cup classic . last one was in the first round of Qatar 2022, with a 2-0 victory for the team .

title: Texas coach Steve Sarkisian: Arch Manning has 'grandpa's gene'
content: arch Manning is set to start for the Longhorns at quarterback in 2025 . he'll be the longhorns' full-time starting quarterback this fall . the program is facing big expectations after reaching the semifinals of the college football Playoff .

title: Why Stanford softball is playing its 2025 season in the football stadium
content: a new, $50 million softball stadium will be built in 2023 . allister was on cloud nine after the announcement that she was planning to build the stadium . she felt fortunate that the university was showing this commitment to her program . the stadium's construction is rare, and she felt lucky that it was a success .
